page.title: 06LANGUAGE & DIALECT
page.content: All those names are place names of Cornish origin.They often refer to features of the landscape.Penhale = Pen(Head or top) + Hale(moor). Surnames of Cornish origin include Annear,Barbery,Carkeek,Clemo,Cundy, Rescorl & Rosevear.These surnames also have an English meaning e.g. Rosevear Ros (heath) + Vur (large).Although Cornish as a language is rarely spoken in our area,it has influenced the local dialect.The older people tend to use dialect form more than the younger ones.Backalong=in the past,Brave few= a good number,Cakey=stupid,Crib=packed lunch,Dreckly=soon,Emmets=ants/tourist Maid=girl,Proper job=Satisfactory,Scat =Knock over,Squalin=crying,Taesy= iritable,To=often used to end questions:"where's it to".Up country= the land that exists beyound the Tamar.
